intro: Trachynotia juncea, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, and it blooms during the summer months. Trachynotia juncea is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
